events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection resulting in damages to the front bumper and side mirror.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and details provided by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and to contact the claimant for further procedure and documentation.
Acknowledgment of receipt of claim was sent to the customer along with an outline of the next steps in the claims process.
Request for police report, photos of the damage, and vehicle registration documents was sent to the claimant to proceed with the investigation.
Claimant submitted all required documents including accident photos, police report, and repair estimates from a licensed mechanic.
Initial investigation has begun including verification of police report and contacting repair shop for damage assessment.
Investigation completed with confirmation of claim validity; damage verified and liability assessment finalized.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant detailing coverage amount and repair costs eligible for reimbursement.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the proposed coverage and support received.
Final approval was granted by the claims department after all conditions were verified and customer agreed to terms.
Payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account covering the repair expenses as outlined in the settlement.
The claim file has been closed successfully following payment disbursement and confirmation of repair completion.
The claim records were archived in the system for future reference and compliance with regulatory retention policies.
